snippet: Sam Querrey lost to Marin Cilic in 5 hours 31 minutes on Saturday, making it the second-longest singles match in Wimbledon history, next to John Isner’s 11 hour 5 minute marathon in 2010.
abstract: Marin Cilic defeats Sam Querrey in men's third round at Wimbledon in 5 hours 31 minutes, making it the second-longest singles match in tournament history, behind John Isner and Nicolas Mahunt’s 11 hour 5 minute marathon in 2010.
lead_paragraph: Sam Querrey lost to Marin Cilic in 5 hours 31 minutes on Saturday, making it the second-longest singles match in Wimbledon history, next to John Isner’s 11 hour 5 minute marathon in 2010.

headline.seo: Querrey-Cilic Match Was Long but Not the Longest
headline.main: Querrey-Cilic: A Long Match but Hardly the Longest
